strings:
<se_high>Jessica: Is this real?
Or is it a dream?

<se_high>Jessica: I feel like I'm in a fairy tale!
This is so amazing!

<se_high>Jessica: So ordinary things like clothes and houses have memories?
They have dreams!?
<se_high>Jessica: Does that explain the vision I had in the Tower of Alexandra?

<se_low>Yangus: Better just to close yer eyes an' pretend you ain't seen nuffin' when ya get an eyeful o' stuff ya dunno wot to do wiv.<page>Yangus: Just like when yer caught on the job.
Deny ev'ryfin'!

<se_low>Yangus: Wot d'ya think, guv?
How about we just say none o' this ever 'appened, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: People 'ave been tellin' me I've got a brain the size of a pea ever since I was small.
<se_low>Yangus: The outside o' me might 'ave got a bit bulkier, but the old grey stuff's still as small as ever.
<se_low>Yangus: So...
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't got a clue about nuffin'!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Well, being kicked out of the abbey has proven to be a passport to some pretty strange experiences.
<se_def>Angelo: This is the perfect location for a bit of after hours socialising... Not too public... Yes...

<se_def>Angelo: Hm? What? Oh, nothing.
I was just talking to myself.
Don't worry about it.

<se_def>Angelo: ...What IS that? Human?
...No. He looks normal enough, but...

<se_def>Angelo: Well, anyway.
He doesn't look like he poses a threat.
I say we trust him.

<se_def>Angelo: Take my word for it, I can read people's intentions.
It's one of the things that makes me good at cards.<page>Angelo: People with twisted souls always give themselves away.
Like Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: Um, don't you think we should make the ship our first priority? We need to go to Trodain Castle and find out more about it.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess it's okay to take a detour, but we shouldn't waste too much time.
<se_low>Yangus: It was that Dhoulmagus who covered the castle wiv thorns then, eh? There's prob'ly monsters inside.
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we should go an' do a bit of confessin' in church first, guv. Make sure this Goddess is on our side an' all that. Better safe than sorry!
<se_def>Angelo: You know, we've still got unfinished business at Trodain Castle.
<se_def>Angelo: I thought old freaky-features said we should look for something in the library. It's disrespectful not to listen to what he says, you know.
<se_high>Jessica: I never imagined we'd have another chance to visit this place!

<se_high>Jessica: So that time back in Ascantha...
It wasn't a dream!
<se_low>Yangus: Make sure you watch where you're walkin', guv.
<se_low>Yangus: Who knows wot'd 'appen if ya fell over in a funny place like this, eh?
<se_def>Angelo: Ascantha and Trodain are quite a long way away from each other, right? So how can they both have doorways leading to exactly the same place?
<se_high>Jessica: Okay. We need to find this Moonshadow harp and give it to Ishmahri, so that he can use it to get the ship moving again. Right?
<se_high>Jessica: Well, it doesn't sound like the kind of thing we'll be able to just waltz into a shop and buy. Guess we'd better start looking around!

<se_low>Yangus: The Moonshadow 'arp...
Even I ain't never 'eard o' that, in all me long years o' thievin'.
<se_low>Yangus: It's all very well that funny bloke sayin' it's out there somewhere, but that don't exactly 'elp us, does it!?<page>Yangus: I mean 'e coulda been a bit more spific!
<se_def>Angelo: So someone we've already met on our journey has the Moonshadow harp.
<se_def>Angelo: It sounds like it's quite a treasure, so I'd guess it probably belongs to royalty.
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: No matter how many times I come here, I can't shake the feeling that I'm in a dream.
<se_high>Jessica: I mean, look around! It's like a fairy tale come to life! Everything's so beautiful that it's hard to believe it's real.

<se_low>Yangus: So if we 'and over the Moonshadow 'arp, that weird geezer'll 'elp us get the boat movin'.
That was the deal, right?

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then!
Wot are we waitin' for!?
<se_def>Angelo: So now we'll see the ‘miraculous’ Moonshadow harp in action. I can hardly contain my excitement. Ishmahri, after all, isn't tone-deaf or a mole.
<se_high>Jessica: Okay. We need to find this Moonshadow harp and give it to Ishmahri, so that he can use it to get the ship moving again. Right?
<se_high>Jessica: Well, it doesn't sound like the kind of thing we'll be able to just waltz into a shop and buy. Guess we'd better start looking around!

<se_low>Yangus: ...I ain't got a clue wot's wot no more.
I need ya, guv!
<se_def>Angelo: If that Ishmahri character can remember when the ship last sailed, he must be positively ancient.

<se_def>Angelo: Maybe he's some kind of ghost or spirit medium.
Are you sure he can be trusted?
